attributes.description: This dashboard presents per data stream usage information, allowing you to align ILM policy, cluster architecture with actual consumption patterns.

params.markdown:
# Indices and data streams usage dashboard

This dashboard will require Elasticsearch monitoring data (built-in or Metricbeat module / Elasticsearch integration) to be collected in this cluster, **and** the `logs-elasticsearch.index_pivot-default` [transform](/app/management/data/transform) to be started.

This dashboard will provide tier- and data stream-centric consumption information, such as:
* Ingest volume (written on disk, after indexing by Elasticsearch).
* Query volume (by count and time).
* Storage volume.


This will help you review your data usage and ensure alignment between expectations, usage patterns, ILM policy and architecture best practices.

embeddableConfig.description: Computed over the last 7 days of the viewed time range
Computed over the last 7 days of the viewed time range

panelsJSON.title: Querying time by tier over time

attributes.description: This displays the querying time, function of how old the queried indices are. Querying volume usually decreases as the index ages. Best practices would recommend to align retention with querying profile, and storing data in colder tier as its consumption volume decreases.

embeddableConfig.description: This displays the query count, function of how old the queried indices are. Querying volume usually decreases as the index ages. Best practices would recommend to align retention with querying profile, and storing data in colder tier as its consumption volume decreases.

This displays the primary stored volume, function of how old the indices are. As the indices age, they should typically be stored in colder tiers, unless there's a business justification for doing otherwise.

attributes.description: This displays the querying time, function of how old the queried indices are. Querying volume usually decreases as the index ages. Best practices would recommend to align retention with querying profile, and storing data in colder tier as its consumption volume decreases.

embeddableConfig.description: This displays the query time, function of how old the queried indices are. Querying volume usually decreases as the index ages. Best practices would recommend to align retention with querying profile, and storing data in colder tier as its consumption volume decreases.
This excludes replications, and considers the backing store size for partially mounted snapshots.
This excludes replications, and considers the backing store size for partially mounted snapshots.
Please note that this line can appear "jittery" because of the underlying merge activity of the cluster.
